intro: Mayna pubescens, commonly known as the hairy mayna, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its pubescent (hairy) stems and leaves, which give it its common name. The plant produces small, showy flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. Mayna pubescens is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories or along stream banks.
